response.answer_text: Well, apparently there are many wrong ways that you can try to kill yourself. Rat Poison - I don't know why people have this obsession with rat poisoning, Ekta Kapoor has totally brainwashed people's minds. Firstly, yes you might die due to rat poisoning, but it might even take weeks, in fact it takes about 3 or 4 days to notice any symptoms. At first there will be internal bleeding, resulting in loss of blood through urine and stool, then vomiting, followed by scars and bruises on your face, and then if you are lucky, if there is an organ failure, then you might die.Hanging yourself on the fan - Well, nowadays fans are made of plastic, and are designed to hold maximum 25 kgs and if you live in an apartment, then there's a pretty slim chance of experiencing instant death, as you need to drop from minimum 9 feet to die instantly, without pain, and apartments are not usually that tall. In old houses, fans were made of steel and ceiling used to be very high, they don't have the provisions these days.Jumping off your building - Well, now we are talking about possibilities, but note this, even jumping off the 6th floor of a tall building has a fatality rate of less than 33%, and you'll end up on a wheelchair, paralysis maybe.Cutting yourself with a sharp object - Well, be sure as to where you are cutting yourself, a cut at a random place on your body might just result in bleeding and then clot, you will not die, rather end up in severe pain from which you'll scream to escape, and just disturb your neighbours.So, be assured as to how you decide to kill yourself, and please do let me know about it.

I’m not sure if you’re in crisis right now, and need immediate intervention… or if you’re just starting to have some suicidal thoughts. But I want to help you. I don’t want you want to kill yourself. I want to teach you to work through your problems, whatever they might be. Solutions are out there. You just need some help finding them. You also need to know you’re not alone! I’ve been where you are! For now, if you’re seriously in crisis, then call someone. Here are some international numbers (since I don’t know where you are in this world.) Also know that I, too, have felt the pain, depression, isolation, and any other negative feelings you’re feeling right now. And I overcame them. So can you. If you’re still thinking about killing yourself, that’s good – that means there’s a small part of you that has hope and wants to live despite the crap you’re going through. The fact that you’re here is GOOD. Please stay. AND I WANT TO HELP YOU. If you are a teenager, and you want to kill yourself, I have something to tell you. You’re brain isn’t done growing yet! It’s true! It will stop growing around age 21. Also, the feelings you’re having are totally and completely natural. Yes, you’re normal, believe it or not! And there are tons of places that can help you. Trust me. If you have a parent, I’d like for you to read what this guy went through when he discovered his daughter had committed suicide. If you’re an adult, please know that you’re not alone. There are people who can help you. Anytime, day or night. Just call a hotline. Here’s one. If you don’t like that one, here’s another resource for you. In fact, nowadays, there are tons! Google search is your best friend. Try using it. Don’t be afraid. Please read: Dhwani Desai's answer to Does suicide help to end everything for a boy suffering from depression?

It’s not a question of how, but why? Why do you want to kill yourself? Ask yourself if you really want to kill yourself. I’ve been having pervasive suicidal thoughts for a long time now, but I realized that I don’t want to die, I just want my life to get better. Isn’t that what you want? Wouldn’t you prefer your life to get better rather than just end it all and never know what sort of happiness you could have potentially obtained if you stayed alive? Think not how to kill yourself, but how to better yourself and your overall life. instead of dwelling on finding ways to end your life, use that same energy in figuring out ways to make it better. Because you know deep down in your heart, that if things in your life weren’t shit, and they got better then you would love to be alive, right? So stop wasting your time thinking about what you really don’t want to do ( killing your self), and focus on what you really want ( to make your life better). makes sense now doesn’t it?😎

Don’t. Please talk with someone. Need Help? Contact a suicide hotline if you need someone to talk to. If you have a friend in need of help, please encourage that person to contact a suicide hotline as well.- WorldwideIn general, if you're outside the US, numbers for your country are here: Help a friend - Befrienders Worldwide. Please don’t. I know it’s easy for me to say and I don’t know your situation, but I have been there plenty of times. It’s an awful feeling, but there is someone out there that needs you and cares about you and they would be lost without you. One of the songs I have listened to a lot lately is “Hold on” by Overstreet. It takes you out of your perspective and puts you into the perspective of the person that cares and is gonna lose you. Please know that there is always help out there for you. Someone loves you and you mean the world to them. Keep going. It will get better
